column3: Man Kills Wife  and Runs Away.
column6: PBO January 24,2020, In Robertsport, Doelein District, Vah community, A man killed his wife in cold blood on December 10. 2019, the man ran away in the hole community, while the dead wife family are still grieving.

column3: A 35 years old man badly beat up his girl friend for Sex.
column6: PBO On January 24.2020. In A99 Salala District Bong County a 35 years old man badly beat up his innocent girlfriend for refusing him sex. Neighbors call the Police on him and the Police took him straight to jail for investigation.

column3: Land Dispute  between Sarkonedu Town and  Tarwulehs Familly from Marvinkonedu Town Quardu,  Gboni District Lofa County.
column6: On January 28, 2020, A conflict took place in the County between Former Town Chief of Sarkonedu Town and the Tarwulehs Familly from Marvinkonedu Town Quardu, Gboni District Lofa County. consending Claiming ownership on inheritance land since 1952 which was giving to the grandfather of  former Town chief, Therefore, issues resulted of cutting down the  plantation on the farm of former Town chief.

column3: Man Severely Beats Wife in Cape Mount
column5: Kinjor, Gola Konneh District, Grand Cape Mount, Liberia
column6: On January 28, 2020 in Kinjor Town, Gola Konneh District, Grand Cape Mount county, a man severely beat his wife and broke teeth because he suspected her of having an affair. He was arrested by the Police and the woman was taken to the clinic for treatment.

column6: On January 28, 2020,  Zuo Town, Gbarma district, Gbarpolu county, a plank car had an accident while on their way to town. Two persons died and the others were sent to Bomi for medical treatment.

column3: January 26 2020, Gasoline is  in Demand  in Sarkonedu Town Quardu Gboni District Lofa County
column5: Sarkonedu Town Quardu Gboni district Lofa County, Liberia
column6: On January 26 2020, Gasoline is in demand  in Sarkonedu Town Quardu Gboni District Lofa County, for more then 5 days now transportation caused is very high due to the shortish of Gas. Liters of gasoline now sold for three hundred and fifty Liberian Dollars (350 LD) While a gallon sold for one thousand two hundred  and fifty Liberian Dollars (1250 LD) therefore, most of the activities are yet to be affected.
